title.narrative: OUTPUT 2. [HARMFUL PRACTICES]

description.narrative: By the end of 2019, communities in the program priority areas have acquired knowledge and skills to abandon FGM/C and child marriage, and the use of victims care services., which contributes to Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: [Child Protection]: By 2019, children, especially girls, are better protected against violence, abuse and exploitation.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2019, communities in the program priority areas have acquired knowledge and skills to abandon FGM/C and childmarriage, and the use of victims care services.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued its efforts towards the abandonment of female genital mutilation (FGM) and child marriage in 358 villages in Kayes, Koulikoro, Mopti regions and Bamako District. In 2019, 67,195 children were provided with prevention and care interventions to address child marriage, a key result for children, exceeding the 2019 target. Also 118 public declarations of abandonment of FGM/C and 123 of child marriage were made in Koulikoro region. More than 135,300 community members regularly participated in community dialogues preventing child marriage and FGM. Survivors were able to access improved health, psychosocial, legal services as well as income generating activities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:06/02/2020
